intro: Senecio comosus var. culcitioides, commonly known as the woolly blueweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with soft, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. This variety is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
